III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
No technical assistance was required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The Chief Administrator inquired about what would be required if the agency chose
to partner with local courts to provide adoptive assessment for stepparent adoptions.
It was recommended that the agency obtain the court requirements for these studies
to review and determine if this would fall under licensing rules.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The files reviewed were well organized and contained all required documents were
present. The chief administrator assessment indicated that the agency would be
implementing new checklists to add more description of the safety of the home in
home studies. While the home studied reviewed met the minimum licensing
standard, it is agreed that sections of the report could use additional description and
information.
The DCWL Field Analyst visited three of the four licensed foster homes and no
concerns were reported by any of those families.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
